blog.name: themariobrosdotnet
blog.title: Super Mario Bros Fan Blog - Dedicated to everything Mario!
blog.description:
We post up funny pictures, game guides, videos and random stuff all dedicated to the worlds most famous plumbers, the Super Mario Bros - Mario and Luigi!

 

This blog is run by Luke, an ancient character in the online Marioverse - the webmaster of Super Mario Bros - Mario & Luigi Mega Fansite

 

Do you remember: Super Mario Portal (back in 2001-2003) this site was one of the most popular and complete Mario websites on the net at the time. My old site!

 

Wanted: Reviewers & Features article writers - please contact me if you want to help with the site! - luke@classic-mario.net

summary: So when I saw Captain Marvel with my mom, there was a trailer for Frozen 2 and a trailer for Detective Pikachu. I didn’t really...
body:
So when I saw Captain Marvel with my mom, there was a trailer for Frozen 2 and a trailer for Detective Pikachu. I didn’t really hear much of a reaction to Frozen 2 but so many people were super hyped for Detective Pikachu.

I’m not surprised

body:
Detective Pikachu after-credits scene

We see Detective Pikachu interviewing a potential new recruit at the police station, and he says something like “You know what, I’m not sure if you really fit our requirements… but I can’t say no to that face. YOU’RE HIRED!”

And the camera switches perspective to reveal that the new recruit is a really happy Mimikyu.

summary: Okay, so here’s a silly idea just for fun. What if Jessie, James and Meowth were secondary villains for the Detective Pikachu...
body:
Okay, so here’s a silly idea just for fun.

What if Jessie, James and Meowth were secondary villains for the Detective Pikachu sequel?

Like, Giovanni after hearing reports about Mewtwo in Ryme City and DP and Tim’s involvement with it, decides to send the TRio to capture Detective Pikachu because he assumes he’s exceptionally powerful being able to put up a fight against a legendary, and also to try and force some information about Mewtwo’s whereabout out of Tim.

So for the whole movie while Tim and Detective Pikachu are trying to solve another mystery, there’s a subplot going on where Team Rocket engage in numerous over the top schemes to try and capture DP, only to have them all end in complete failure in Wile E Coyote esque fashion, to which Tim and Pikachu barely even notice.

Then towards the end of the movie, Jessie, James and Meowth get fed up of things blowing up in their faces and decide to just attack the two with one of their giant poke-mechas… only to end up having to help Tim and Pikachu fight and defeat the actual main villains of the movie, and being sent blasting off at the last minute before they have a chance to make their move and snatch DP. Tim and Detective Pikachu don’t even realise they were trying to kidnap them and regret not getting to thank them properly for their assistance.

Like, this probably isn’t going to happen, but am I the only one who thinks this would be fun?

Okay, so here’s a silly idea just for fun.

What if Jessie, James and Meowth were secondary villains for the Detective Pikachu sequel?

Like, Giovanni after hearing reports about Mewtwo in Ryme City and DP and Tim’s involvement with it, decides to send the TRio to capture Detective Pikachu because he assumes he’s exceptionally powerful being able to put up a fight against a legendary, and also to try and force some information about Mewtwo’s whereabout out of Tim.

So for the whole movie while Tim and Detective Pikachu are trying to solve another mystery, there’s a subplot going on where Team Rocket engage in numerous over the top schemes to try and capture DP, only to have them all end in complete failure in Wile E Coyote esque fashion, to which Tim and Pikachu barely even notice.

summary: Only 8 weeks and 2 days until Detective Pikachu hits theatres. I feel like I’m just constantly counting down the days until it...
body:
Only 8 weeks and 2 days until Detective Pikachu hits theatres.

I feel like I’m just constantly counting down the days until it comes out now. It feels like it’s taking an eternity.
